Exaggerate: The claim of a social media ban during the Sri Lankan election is exaggerated as there was no plan to block social media websites, according to the Elections Commission Chairman.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a misleading Facebook post and tweet, while the Elections Commission Chairman explicitly stated that there was no social media ban.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that social media services were readily available in Sri Lanka without the need for a VPN on the days of the election.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that there was a social media ban during the Sri Lankan election, despite evidence to the contrary.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that the misleading claim was spread intentionally to create fear and uncertainty among social media users during the election.
